characters: THE NEW EDGE OF THE PRECIPICE, (ILM ELEMENTS)
FAVORING KIRK AND CREW, PAST KRUGE

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: As the stars appear, we hear the AMBIENCE OF SPACE, a litany of groans, squeals and pings of the unknown. Over this we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are MOVING through the stars slowly and to our right as the SUPER FADES. And we hear a hoarse voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space... the final frontier. Our MOVE CONTINUES to reveal the Genesis planet and its sun, which flares into our lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) These are the continuing voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Her ongoing mission... The sunflare has DISSOLVED us to the planet's primal surface. We are MOVING through the trees and greens of this Eden-like place. A soft, smoky haze covers every- thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) To explore strange new worlds... To seek out new life forms, and new civilizations... To boldly go, where no man has gone before... And now, amid the trees, we see it, and CAMERA comes to a brief rest: Spock's casket, a photon torpedo tube, black with red letters, "Mark VI." The STAR TREK FAN- FARE is heard, and we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREDITS BEGIN. As they appear, we MOVE away from the casket and through the lush forest. The haze thickens, until at last it becomes an obliter- ating cloud, and then we DISSOLVE through into moving clouds of the planet's atmosphere, and PULL BACK from them, DISSOLVING once again back to space and the Gene- sis planet where we HOLD as CREDITS END. Then, a final SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the SOUND of an approaching SPACESHIP.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: A mid-sized Federation Science Vessel approaching at impulse power. She PASSES CAMERA, and we PAN WITH her to see her path leads to the Genesis Planet in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet LIEUTENANT SAAVIK, looking radiant, is wear- ing her hair down these days, but is as intense and efficient as ever. The CRACKLE OF ELECTRONIC ACTIVITY fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing bridge) We are approaching destination planet at point zero three five. So noted in ship's log. She delivers the log to the Captain as ANGLE WIDENS to include CAPTAIN ESTEBAN, late forties, a cautious Star- fleet veteran. Behind him, various OFFICERS on station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Lieutenant. Execute standard orbital approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard orbit, aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications. Send a coded message for Starfleet Commander, priority one... "Federation Science Vessel Grissom arriving Genesis Planet, Mutara Sector to begin search. As ordered, full security procedures are in effect. J.T. Esteban, commanding."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye sir, coding now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Dr. Marcus, it's your planet. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal DAVID MARCUS, mid-twenties, who will be remembered as the co-creator of Genesis, and also as Kirk's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain. Begin scanning, please. Saavik has taken a position next to David at the sci- ence panel and together they begin activating the de- vices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; enthusiastically) This is where the fun begins, Saavik!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working) Like your father... so human. (then) All units functional, recorders are on... Scanning sector one. Foliage in fully developed state of growth. Temperature, twenty- two point two Celsius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sector two... Indicating desert terrain. Minimal vegetation, temperature thirty-nine point four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sector three... Sub-tropical vegetation... Temperature -- (puzzled) Temperature decreasing rapidly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's snow. Snow in the same sector. Fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the varieties of land and weather known to Earth within a few hours walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him) You must be very proud of what you and your mother have created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking) It's a little early to celebrate. Suddenly... BEEP... BEEP... BEEP... a new and unique SOUND is heard from the MONITORS. Saavik flicks con- trols and a new image appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same sector. Metallic mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underground deposit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, on surface... A manufactured object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing it could be... Short range scan. Saavik complies. David's intensity rises. Captain Esteban, curious about the BEEPS, has joined them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximately two meters long... Cylindrical in form...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photon tube...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be Spock's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be. Gravitational fields were in flux... It must have soft landed...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Comm Officer) In code to STARFLEET... Captain's Spock's tube located intact on Genesis surface. Will relay more data on subsequent orbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir... Coding your message. As the BEEPS DIMINISH, we HOLD on David and Saavik. There is mystery in the air.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: She comes AT US slowly, majestically, a great wounded bird limping home, showing, as she passes, the patched scars of battle. Over this we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: USS Enterprise, Captain's personal log... With most of our battle damage repaired, we are almost home. Yet, I feel -- uneasy. And I wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES T. KIRK
dialogues.text: He is stalking the bridge, lost in his thoughts. CAMERA IS MOVING with him. In b.g., bridge activity is normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Perhaps it is the erratic behavior of Ship's surgeon McCoy... Or the emptiness of this vessel: most of our trainee crew have been reassigned; Lieutenant Saavik and my son David are exploring a new world... and Enterprise feels like a house with all the children gone... No. More empty even than that... He has reached Spock's vacant chair. He touches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The news of Spock's tube has shaken me. (beat) It seems that I have left the noblest part of myself back there, on that newborn planet. We HOLD on him. Then, he shakes off his mood and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Status, Mr. Sulu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to include SULU and CHEKOV at forward stations, UHURA at the communications post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On course, Admiral. Estimating Spacedock in two point one hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. (a beat) Mr. Chekov, I need pre-approach scan... Take the science station, please. Chekov hesitates for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He rises and crosses to Spock's empty chair, as Kirk continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, any response from Starfleet on our Project Genesis inquiries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.. Very odd. (at chair, hits comm button) Scotty. Progress report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY and an ENGINEER TRAINEE are working at a junc- tion of circuitry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost done, sir. You'll be fully automated by the time we dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your timing is excellent, Mr. Scott. You've fixed the barn door after the horse has come home. How much refit time till we can take her out again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight weeks, sir. (as Kirk opens his mouth) But you don't have eight weeks so I'll do it for ya in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) Mr. Scott. Have you always multiplied your repair estimates by a factor of four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir. How else can I keep my reputation as a miracle  worker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your reputation is secure, Scotty. (a beat) Mr. Sulu, take the con. I'll be in my quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye sir. Kirk heads for the elevator, presses the door button. He is about to enter when he is intercepted by TRAINEE FOSTER, a young black officer too eager for protocol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... I was wondering... Kirk turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Are they planning a ceremony when we get in...? I mean, a reception...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hero's welcome, son? Is that what you'd like?... Well, God knows, there should be. This time we paid for the party with our dearest blood. He enters the elevator, and the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even as the doors close, his mood changes. The mantle of command falls away and he allows himself the luxury of his deeper feelings. Feelings of aloneness. And grief. CAMERA IN CLOSE to HOLD this anguished moment. Then, an intrusive interruption. Kirk covers hiss feel- ings as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open at a floor and "BONES" McCOY steps in. He is disheveled, unshaven -- and in a very odd emotional place. He takes his place in the eleva- tor and gazes at the ceiling as the doors close, and the HUM BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bones. (stiffly) Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause, with growing irritation) Are you planning to shave today? Quo vadis, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean? What is our destination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be orbiting Earth in two hours. Then we're headed in the wrong direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning) Bones, don't do this. This is me. Jim. Your friend. And I have been, and always shall be, yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Bones, don't quote Spock to me! I have enough pain of my own and I don't need your -- self- indulgence! Bones, his eyes far away, turns to make contact. In a matter-of-fact voice: You left me. You left me on Genesis. Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) ... What the hell are you saying? Even Bones is stunned by what has come out of his mouth. He tries to cope with his own disorientation. (shaken) I don't know... I just... (then, poignantly) Why did we leave Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Bones!... You must deal with the truth! He's gone. Spock is gone. And we both have to live with that. Bones looks at Kirk for an agonized moment. Then, the elevator comes to a stop, the doors opens. McCoy takes a step out, then turns back to Kirk. I can't get him out of my head, Jim. I'd give the whole state of Georgia if someone could tell me why. McCoy leaves. The doors close on Jim Kirk's concern.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Over the vast emptiness we SUPER: "SOMEWHERE IN ORGANIAN SPACE..." As the SUPER FADES, a vessel drifts slowly INTO SCENE, a dark-looking merchantman. She gives the impression of drifting in space... of waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small and grubby; populated by three or four crewmen of mixed special breeds, and a renegade CAPTAIN who sug- gests a Federation traitor. And, lurking in the shadows, her face concealed by a half-veil, what ap- pears to be an exotically beautiful WOMAN of epic pro- portions and mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... Steady, boys. Keep scanning... (beat) I thought you people were reliable... Where the hell is he!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has been here for some time. I can feel his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me your Klingon mumbo- jumbo -- there ain't another vessel in this whole damn quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me on the hailing frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sourly) Sure - whatever games you wanna play. He shakes his head, presses a button and nods to her. She now removes the veil, showing us a fascinating face of Klingon features. The crew stare at her as she speaks into a communication device. She is oddly un- emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Kruge: this is Valkris. I have obtained the Federation data, and am ready to transmit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRUGE'S PET A SHOCK CUT to a frightening creature, half timber wolf, half lizard. His head is being rubbed by the hand of the owner. We PAN UP from the beast with Kruge's hand as it snaps switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Valkris... Stand by. The PAN CONTINUES UPWARD to reveal BATTLE COMMANDER KRUGE, a Klingon War Lord of handsome but frightening presence, and relative youth. Now, in Klingon:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Disengage cloaking device!) There is a light change from CLOAK to DE-CLOAKED CON- DITION, along with ELECTRONIC WHIRRING SOUNDS. CAMERA PULLS BACK from man and beats during this to reveal the entire Klingon bridge which suggests the relationship of galley master to slave.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: We are SHOOTING PAST the merchantman in the f.g. to watch the strange  and gradual appearance of a vessel.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY, (ILM/DECLOAKING EFFECT)
dialogues.text: Breathtaking. Skeletally at first, then filled in a section at a time, a small deadly looking warship forms. It is the Bird of Prey, a long-necked, scary looking thing, with variable wing attitude which we will see in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring) What the hell...? As he and the crew try to comprehend, a commanding voice on SPEAKERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Valkris...Transmit data on my command... Now! The woman leans to the console. She inserts a small rectangular object and presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCHANTMAN) Kruge rises from his regal station, crosses to a moni- tor where OFFICER MALTZ adjusts incoming material. We cannot see clearly what is coming in, but occasional images suggest material concerning the Genesis Project. As the high speed transmission ends:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmission completed. You will find it essential to your mission. Maltz hands Kruge the completed recording. Kruge taps it thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Then you have seen it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (I have, my lord.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a cloud) (That is unfortunate.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (I understand.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruge has a moment of hesitation. Then, to his helmsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Thrusters!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The variable wings begin to dip like hawk's talons, and the Bird begins an arcing maneuver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncertainty. The Captain turns to the Woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? When do we get paid off...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, Captain... Quite soon. (to communicator) (Success, my lord -- and my love.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (You will be remembered with honor.) (to gunner) (Fire.)

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey, its wings in the menacing attack position swoops toward the merchant ship. From the two claw-like tips of the Bird of Prey, phaser beams (of a new type) erupt, SIZZLE -- EXPLOSIONS rip the outside of the merchantman -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXPLOSIONS and smoke cloud the murky small bridge; the cries of the crew, the Captain's scream of outrage. And through it all, in the smoke, the Woman's face. Unperturbed. As a last act, she ritualistically covers her face with her veil, as she is enveloped in smoke and flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCHANTMAN) The SCREAMS AND CRIES of the merchant crew can be heard. The Captain's voice rises above all these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, help us! Please! We'll keep your damn secrets, just don't let us die in space! Kruge turns impassively to his gunner, and nods. The gunner presses the firing button.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The Klingon Bird FIRES another salvo. The merchantman is obliterated. Debris floats through the SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screams have stopped. Kruge's beats reacts with pleasure. Officer Maltz observes this, subtly wipes his forehead, but making sure Kruge doesn't see him. Kruge pets his beast, then straightens, recording in  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my quarters. Execute course to the Federation Boundary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my lord! As Kruge starts out, the BEAST GROWLS. Kruge stops, points a finger at a Klingon in the sub-deck below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Feed him!) The Klingon nods vigorously as Kruge exits, then, with his commander gone, casts a nervous glance beast-ward.

dialogues.speaker: THE SNARLING BEATS, (ILM)
dialogues.text: A face only a Klingon could love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO SHOT comes USS Grissom, orbiting.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENCE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Much visual display and BEEPING. PULL BACK to find Saavik, David -- with Esteban over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New orbit commencing... Coming up on sector three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short range scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (activates; studies) As before... Metallic mass... Verifying triminium photon tube... No new data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check for trace radiation. Infrared enhancement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she responds) ... Radiation residual... Level is minimal... Suddenly the BEEPS are joined in harmony by a new and subtly different SOUND. Saavik looks at David, who moves closer to her screen, studying it with growing intensity as she adjusts the controls, and the SOUND INCREASES IN VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If equipment is functioning properly, indications are -- an animal life form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to David) You said there wouldn't be any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There shouldn't be any. Only plant forms were built into the Genesis matrix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's re-checked) Cross referenced and verified. An unidentifiable life form reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wish to advise Starfleet, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...! We don't know what we're talking about here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we beam it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't! Regulations specifically state: "nothing shall be beamed aboard until danger of contamination has been eliminated." Can you guarantee that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from here, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... the logical alternative is obvious... beaming down to the surface is permitted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... If the Captain decides that the mission is vital and reasonably free of danger." I know the book, Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, please -- we'll take the risk. We've got to find out what it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Or who. The implication is not lost on Esteban. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- get your gear. I'll put you down next time around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ILM SHOT) with the grandeur of the horizon arc of the great blue marble as a backdrop, Spacedock orbits. INTO SHOT comes Enterprise, heading toward the waiting port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bustle and CRACKLING SOUNDS of approach procedure. Kirk is in the Captain's chair, all others are on sta- tions. Scotty has come up from below to watch the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standby automatic approach system ... Advise approach control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approach control... this is Enterprise. Ready for docking maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise is cleared to dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems locked. The bridge lights change to docking mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacedock, you have control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative, Enterprise. Enjoy the ride, and welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise confirms. With thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slowly rotating Spacedock is huge. Enterprise is coming in on an arc-like course. The great doors of Approach Threshold 15 slide open... Enterprise, with unerring precision, slips from space into the small opening afforded by the doors... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, cavernous area, deigned as an orbital dock for many space vessels. We see Enterprise entering this great warehouse of ships through the doors, and proceed at slow impulse power to her waiting birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: introducing NX 2000, Excelsior, a super starship. Her lines are similar to Enterprise, but she is clearly bigger, sleeker, and very new. She sits at her mooring like the new Queen of Space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ILM ELEMENT) The Excelsior is on screen for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends, the great experiment: Excelsior, ready for trial runs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's supposed to have transwarp drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. And if my grandmother had wheels, she'd be a wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, but as far as I'm concerned, there's nothin' needed for space travel that this old girl doesn't already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come, Scotty. Young minds. Fresh ideas. (dryly) Be tolerant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEMENTS) THROUGH THE WINDOW of a Spacedock facility, a few lounging Starfleet persons look up to see a memorable sight... ... battle-scarred Enterprise is passing alongside of the sleek Excelsior. Their size differential is apparent (B-29 to B-17). Yet, Enterprise carries with her a battle-scarred history of achievement. Some of the Starfleet people begin to rise, silently. A stand- ing ovation for a hero's return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, stand by for final docking procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing by... Mr. Sulu, activate moorings... Stand by umbilical and gravitational support systems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir, moorings activated... All systems standing by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Admiral... This is not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An energy reading from 'C" deck -- from inside Mr. Spock's quarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not patiently) Mr. Chekov, I ordered Spock's quarters sealed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I sealed the room myself. Nevertheless -- I am reading a life form there. Kirk rises on the narrow edge of irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov -- this entire crew seems on the edge of obsessive behavior concerning Mr. Spock. (stays Chekov's protest) I'll have a look... Mr. Sulu, continue docking procedure. He exits, as the rest of the crew reacts. Chekov shrugs to all, indicating that he sees what he sees. And the CAMERA MOVES CLOSE to his panel to verify his belief. On screen -- an energy form is definitely pulsating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they HISS open, and Kirk appears. A SOFT ALARM is  BEEPING O.S. Kirk assesses this, his mood changing to puzzled concern. He starts purposefully OUT OF SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR SECTOR
dialogues.text: He is walking quickly, as the ALARM SOUND increases in frequency. He reacts: breaks into a trot, CAMERA SPEEDING UP WITH him until he arrives at the entrance to Spock's quarters. He examines with shock: a seal- ant coating over the door has been forced with indica- tions of great strength. The ALARM CONTINUES, LOUD now. Kirk TURNS IT OFF with a touch, then cautiously starts in, convinced the problem is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark and shadowy as Kirk enters. He peers, try- ing to adjust his eyesight to the darkness. He steps forward carefully -- trips temporarily on some small object -- but recovers. He moves slowly inward, then stops, staring into the impenetrable dark. Then he reacts, as we hear SPOCK'S VOICE. It is hoarse, raspy, as it was in the final scene with Kirk in Star Trek II. But is unmistakably Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... Help me... take me... up the steps... of Mount Seleya... through the hall of ancient thought...

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Shaken now. He strains into the darkness, looking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the darkened room and COMES TO REST as we see a shadowy figure in the far corner.

dialogues.speaker: 41B BACK TO KIRK
dialogues.text: as he starts forward, all senses alert. As he nears the figure, whoever it is starts to flee, and Kirk grapples with him, like Jacob with the dark Angel. And Kirk pulls him down, panting, and the figure is il- luminated by a shaft of light, and it is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bones McCoy. Emotionally drained, eyes wide --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, what the hell are you doing? Have you lost your mind! (his own voice, but raspy, drained) ... Help me, Jim... Take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we are, Bones. we are home. ... Then perhaps there is still time... Climb the steps, Jim... Climb the steps of Mount Seleya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mount Seleya? Bones, Mount Seleya is on Vulcan! We're home on Earth! Bones looks at him, trying to comprehend. When he  opens his mouth; it is, for one brief moment, SPOCK'S VOICE that emerges: (in Spock's voice) Remember! (and again) Remember! Kirk stares at him in shock as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral: docking is completed. Starfleet Commander Morrow is on his way for inspection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, still holding McCoy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura! Get the medics down here! Get them now! He cradles McCoy who has gone limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, it's all right... As he holds his friend, rocking him gently, we OVERLAP the SHRILL SOUND of an ELECTRONIC BOATSWAIN'S PIPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire crew is assembled as the SOUND of the PIPE FINISES -- and the great docking doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tetsch-hut! STARFLEET COMMANDER MORROW enters, a distinguished looking black man, followed by an AIDE. He crosses to Kirk at the head of the review line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Jim. He reaches for Kirk's shoulders with affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well done. He embraces Kirk. It is both a military courtesy, and a personal expression, twenty-five years of comrade- ship, service and sacrifice. Kirk is moved. When the embrace breaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. (wryly) I take it this is not a formal inspection. A relieved ripple of laughter from all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. At ease, everyone. They relax in the glow of Morrow's smile. And he looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where's Doctor McCoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Indisposed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, too bad... Well... You have all done remarkable service under the most -- difficult of conditions. You'll be receiving Starfleet's highest commendations, and more importantly, extended shore leaves. A buzz of approval, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That is, all but you, Mr. Scott. They need your wisdom on the new Excelsior... Report there tomorrow as Captain of Engineering. It is clear how Scotty feels about this honor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all appreciation, sir, I'd prefer to supervise the refit of Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well... That really won't be necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir -- this refit will take a  practiced hand. There's much to do -- (a look at Kirk) It could be months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Scott, I'm sorry... There isn't going to be a refit. A pall in the room. Kirk, as shocked as anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I don't understand. The Enterprise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, the Enterprise is twenty years old. We think her day is over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we had requested -- we were hoping to take her back to Genesis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a new concern) Genesis?! Whatever for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why -- a natural desire to help finish the work we began!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's out of the question. No one is going to Genesis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask why...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh) Jim, in your absence, Genesis has become a galactic controversy... Until the Federation Council makes policy, you are all under orders not to discuss with anyone your  knowledge of Genesis... Consider it a quarantined planet. And a forbidden subject. On their baffled reactions we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are TRACKING with her through space. She is quite visible, her wings in level configuration.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: At first we are disoriented. Jim Kirk's image FILLS THE SCREEN talking right AT US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fully understand the events on which I report, it is necessary to review the theoretical data on the Genesis Device... We are PULLING BACK. The bridge is lit normally. On screen, Kirk's voice now continues, describing what we see: molecular charts, followed by a barren graphic depiction of a planetoid. Toward it a torpedo arcs, causing fire, inferno, and a resulting new surface, capable of bearing life. (COMPUTER GRAPHIC, STAR TREK II.) This is being watched on the bridge by Kruge, Maltz, and OFFICER TORG, younger than Maltz, more gung- ho.

dialogues.speaker: THE GENESIS TAPE
dialogues.text: with the reactions of the two junior officers, seeing it for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kruge turns the machine off. He studies the two officers. Then with quiet intensity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So! (to Torg) Speak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great power... to control... dominate... destroy. If it works. Kruge considers the answer, turns to Maltz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Impressive... They con make planets... Possibilities are endless... Colonies, resources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... New cities, homes in the country... your woman at your side... children playing at your feet... and overhead, fluttering in the breeze... the flag of the Federation. Charming... (hisses at Maltz) Station!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my lord! Maltz snaps to and leaves, chastened. Kruge turns to Torg like a wily serpent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works. Oh yes, it works. He presses a button and a new visual appears, Kirk's VOICE heard OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... It was this premature detonation of the Genesis device that resulted in the creation of the Genesis planet..." We see Enterprise fleeing the Genesis explosion (STOCK, STAR TREK II). Torg is very impressed. Kruge turns the visual off. Then, importantly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share this with no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to this "planet." Even as our emissaries negotiate for "peace" with the Federation, we will act for the preservation of our race! We will seize the secret of this weapon. The secret of ultimate power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered) Success, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Station! Torg crosses out, Kruge turns toward his chair, kneels to pet his beast as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (My lord: approaching Federation territory...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Steady on course... Engage cloaking device!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cloaking device -- engaged!) Lights change... ELECTRONIC SOUND BEGINS... and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship, sectionally, vanishes before our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: USS Grissom is orbiting. We hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter room, stand by to energize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EFFECT) We are PANNING. An area of great primal beauty, poet- ic, romantic. A smoky haze persists. The PAN STOPS as we hear a familiar ENERGY SOUND: And Saavik and David begin to appear in the BEAM DOWN EFFECT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fully materialized. They are equipped with scientific backpacks. Their TRICORDERS BLEEP reassuringly, as they look about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking as perplexed as she can) Saavik to Grissom. Request computer study of soil samples for geological aging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) I'll handle that later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My readings indicate great instability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not here to investigate geological aging, we're here to find life forms! His TRICORDER BLEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on... Saavik reacts to his tension with a questioning look. Then they move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH SAAVIK) He and his officers are monitoring the progress of the landing party. DATA SOUNDS fill the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, LT. HINES points something out on a viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grissom to landing party. We have you approaching radioactive indications. Do you concur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative, Captain. Our readings are well below danger level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Exercise caution, Lieutenant. This landing is Captain's discretion and I'm the one who's out on a limb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to remember that, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S GLADE
dialogues.text: David is in the lead, a distant figure, then stops to take readings as Saavik catches up to him. Then to- gether they start forward TOWARD US. As they approach, HIGH CAMERA NOW LOWERS until it reveals, in f.g., Spock's casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two explorers take readings; they begin to realize what they are heading for... Their tempo increases, they follow their tricorders, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik and David come INTO VIEW, close by, and stop, seeing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .          .. Spock's tube...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps forward, points) David -- He joins her, staring at:

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S CASKET
dialogues.text: At the base of the tube, worm-like forms shimmy and squirm. They are small , horrible, and unquestionably alive.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK AND DAVID
dialogues.text: They try to maintain their scientific objectivity, in spite of their horror -- and their disappointment at not finding some trace of Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. There's your life form reading. These were microbes on the tube's surface. We shot them here from Enterprise. (with irony) They were fruitful, and multiplied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... How could they have evolved so quickly...? David doesn't answer, his curiosity caught by something else. He starts slowly forward, Saavik Following close. Their tricorders begin to register higher radia- tion levels as they approach the tube.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: David and Saavik's faces as they approach. Feet step among the wormy creatures to gain access to the tube. (ILM) Even the unemotional Saavik reacts to this. David reaches the tube, raises the lid of Spock's bier. He looks inside, and sees:

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S CASKET
dialogues.text: It is empty, except for some kind of rumpled black cloth.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO DAVID
dialogues.text: He reacts, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik... He's gone. He reaches in, withdraws the shroud-like cloth, and hands it to Saavik. As she touches, she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's burial robe. As they stare at each other without answers, the planet makes a gentle RUMBLING SOUND -- then the ground qui- vers slightly. And in the far distance, a poignant CRY is heard. A young animal in pain, perhaps. Saavik and David do not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tranquil. We hear the SOUNDS of HARBOR and distant CITY. We are PULLING BACK, past Kirk as he stares qui- etly at the view, a glass in hand. Then he turns 'round, raises his glass in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absent friends. ANGLE WIDENS to include Uhura, Chekov and Sulu, who toast in response, and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Admiral, what's going to happen to Enterprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's to be decommissioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we get another ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get an answer. Starfleet is up to its brass in galactic conference. No one has time for those who only stand... and wait. Kirk sips his drink thoughtfully, as do all. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is Doctor McCoy, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the good news. He's home in bed, full of tranquilizers, and he promised me he'd stay there... They say it's exhaustion... (a sigh) We'll see. A DOOR CHIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ah. Mr. Scott, fresh from the world of transwarp drive... Come! They all turn toward the door. We hear it WHIRR open, O.S. Their expressions change and they stare at:

dialogues.speaker: ANGLE TOWARD THE DOOR
dialogues.text: A tall, mysterious figure in a hooded Vulcan robe walks slowly toward us, then stops, CLOSE, face unseen. Is it Bones?... A Spock apparition? The figure removes his hood, revealing the distinguished older features of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished) Sarek! A hush of wonder falls over all. The ANGLE WIDENS as AMBASSADOR SAREK comes to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ambassador, I -- I had no idea you were here... (then) I think you know my crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will speak with you alone, Kirk. Kirk turns to his crew. They look at him questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, please. The crew, their concern showing, leave their glasses and file out. Sarek steps to the bay window, looks out in contemplation, his back to Kirk. With the others gone, Kirk comes up behind Sarek. A pause. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sarek... I would have come to Vulcan... to express my deepest sympathies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises a hand) Spare me your human platitudes, Kirk. I have been to your Government. I have seen the Genesis information, and your own report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know how bravely your son met his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Met his death"? (turning on Kirk) How could you, his friend, have assumed that? Why did you leave him on Genesis! Spock trusted you -- and you denied him his future!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- saw no future --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed the point, then and now... Only his body was "in death," Kirk! And you were the last one to be with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must know that you should have come with him to Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he asked you to! He entrusted you with his very essence -- with everything was not of the body. He asked you to bring him to us -- and to bring that which he gave you: his Katra. His living spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply, quietly) Sir. Your son meant more to me than you can know. I'd have given my life if it would have saved his. You must believe me when I tell you that he made no request of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would not have spoken of it openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, how --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Kirk, I must have your thoughts. May I join your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...! Sarek steps close to Kirk as CAMERA PUSHES IN VERY CLOSE. Sarek's hands are on Kirk's temples in familiar splayed fashion. And the eyes of both men are closed.

dialogues.speaker: MIND MELD SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: (This can be LITERAL, or can be illustrated by SUB- LIMINAL FILM from TREK II. To be determined.) Strange, SUB-MUSICAL SOUNDS underscore. The music of Vulcan, unlike anything we have ever heard before. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He spoke of your friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (semi-trance) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked you not to grieve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The needs of the many outweigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The needs of the few...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Or the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been... and always shall be... your friend. Live long... and prosper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, bathed with sweat, suddenly shudders in pain. Sarek opens his eyes, removes his hands. He touches Kirk with gentleness as Jim recovers, opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. It is not here. I assumed he had mind-melded with you. It is the Vulcan way when the body's end is near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he couldn't touch me...! We were separated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... and I understand. (rises wearily) Then everything that he was... Everything that he knew... is lost. And when I return home empty-handed, many shall mourn. He turns now, starting for the door. Kirk stops him with an agonized wail:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please wait!... Surely he would have found a way! If there was so much at stake -- Spock would have found a way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating) Yes... But -- how...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Sarek!... What if he melded with someone else?! On their exchange of looks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are VERY CLOSE on an electronic screen. There is the frozen face of Spock with his hand splayed on the engine room glass. A mechanical voice tells us:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine Room, Flight Recorder Visual. Stardate 8128 point seven eight, point seven eight, point seven eight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back. Point seven seven. The tape begins to speed backwards in a scrambled image.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE
dialogues.text: His face intense. The SOUND of BACKWARD TAPE is heard. Then it stops. On screen: Spock and Kirk in their final conversation. Kirk watches a moment, painfully, then breaks off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back. Point seven six. The computer responds. More BACKWARD SOUND, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight recorder visual. Stardate 8128 point 76, point 76 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. The tape activates. On screen we watch Spock enter the engine room, go to the console. He make a few adjust- ments then heads for the radiation room where he is intercepted by McCoy. Kirk stares in growing fascination. McCoy talks to Spock briefly. Spock tricks McCoy into looking away, then applies the Vulcan nerve pinch. Bones falls. On screen: Spock moves close to McCoy, takes gloves from the unconscious Scott, then places his hand on McCoy's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold! He stares at the frozen image, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Augment and repeat! The CAMERA ZOOMS IN a TIGHT TWO SHOT. The action repeats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly) Freeze...! The image of the critical mind meld is there to see. Kirk is stunned. CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS now, to reveal for the first time that Sarek is with Kirk in the shadowy room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One alive, one not. Yet both in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What must I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must bring them to Mount Selaya -- on Vulcan. Only there is the passage possible. Only there can both find peace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you ask is difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will find a way, Kirk. If you honor them both, you must. Kirk looks at the screen, examines all that is clear to him, and accepts the truth of Sarek's challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I swear. Over his determined face, we hear a weird OVERLAPPED SOUND: the strange CRY OF PAIN from the Genesis Planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A different texture than the Spock Glade. Cactus growth, seeming desert, yet... slightly gnarled, slightly off. Over this empty landscape there is another trembling of the earth. And again, the CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF RUNNING FOOTSTEPS. Then David and Saavik run INO SHOT staring O.S. as the CRY repeats itself. They stare O.S. and see:

dialogues.speaker: VISTA
dialogues.text: Past the tall cactus in f.g., we see snow-covered ter- rain in the middle distance. The CRY is heard once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear it whenever the ground quakes. David's tricorder is making LIFE FORM SOUNDS. Saavik whips out her communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to communicator) Captain, this is Saavik. We have strong life sign readings bearing zero-one-five relative, and we are proceeding to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We concur, Saavik. And Saavik... be advised we are reading a severe and unnatural age curve on the planet. I'm getting nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look to David) Do you have an explanation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grissom, your message acknowledged. Will advise... Out. And she hurries after David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: USS Grissom, out. (bends over his science station) What the hell's going on down there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VISTAVISION) David leading, Saavik catching up as they enter a snow- covered patch of ground. CAMERA TRACKS with them now as the WIND begins to HOWL, and the first visible snow- flakes begin to fall. As the wind and snow increase, causing them to hold their hands up against the ele- ments, they stop and stare outward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the snow-covered landscape ahead of them, a series of tracks. Small, indeterminate. They lead ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SAAVIK AND DAVID
dialogues.text: They respond. The WIND HOWLS, but they start forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Absolutely not, Jim, it's out of the question! ANGLE HAS WIDENED to include Kirk, a passionate Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply) Harry. I'm off the record now. I'm not speaking as one of your staff. I'm talking about thirty years of service. I have to do this, Harry. It has to do with my honor, my life -- everything I put any value on. The intimacy of the conversation is broken by a star- fleet steward who bears drinks. Kirk sits in frus- trated suspension until the steward leaves. Then Kirk tries to resume his plea, but Morrow stays him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... You are my best officer and if I had a best friend, you'd be that too. But I am Commander, Starfleet, so I don't break rules!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't quote rules, Harry! We're talking about loyalty. And sacrifice. One man who died for us, another who has deep emotional damage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute! This business about Spock  and McCoy... Honestly, I have never understood Vulcan mysticism -- I'm sorry! But part of me doesn't want you to make a fool of yourself... Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, you don't have to believe! I'm not even sure I believe. But if there's even a chance that Spock has an eternal soul -- then that is my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As surely as if it were my own! (deeply) Harry, give me back the Enterprise! With Scotty's help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jim! Enterprise would never stand the pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll find a ship -- I'll hire a ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the question! The Council has ordered that no one but the science team goes to Genesis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Then let me speak to the Council! Harry, please! I can make them understand!! Kirk's voice and passion has risen enough to now gather a response from neighboring tables. Kirk re- alizes; he checks himself, draws slightly back. Morrow is firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you understand...! The Council has its hands full with Klingons and Romulans! They're trying to hammer out a treaty on the Genesis Device and they haven't got time for your personal views on friendship and metaphysics! (beat) Jim! Your life and your career stand for rationality, not intellectual chaos. Keep up this emotional behavior and you'll lose everything. You'll destroy yourself! (deeply) Do you hear me, Jim? Kirk looks for a long moment, then sighs, his body sagging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I hear you. (a beat) I just had to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... Now take my suggestion, enjoy your leave -- and let all this tension blow away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh) You're right. (toasts) Thanks for the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time. Kirk rises with a smile, starts out. HOLD on Morrow.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: He crosses the room filled with Starfleet senior officers, CAMERA TRACKING until he passes out of the main room, into the entry room -- where we are sur- prised to see Sulu and Chekov waiting for him conspir- atorially. Kirk stops close to them, looks about cau- tiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word is no. (a beat) I am therefore going anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count on our help, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need it, Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I alert Dr. McCoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He has a long journey ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded, smoke-filled watering hole of the twenty- third century, filled with a smattering of civilians, Starfleet personnel, and visitors from strange and far- off civilizations. It does not have the bizarre quali- ties of the "Star Wars Bar" which is across the street. McCoy is discovered entering the bar. He is haggard, less than clean shaved. He appears to be looking for something as he starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING THROUGH THE BAR, (ILM ELEMENT)
dialogues.text: noting patrons at the twenty-third century equivalent of video games, darts. We see two people playing at a holographic version of a video game, in which World War 1 biplanes are engaged in 3-d combat... and a dart player throwing pneumatic jet propelled darts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81   BACK TO McCOY Not finding what he is looking for, he settles into a small alcove. A seedy, but attractive WAITRESS ar- rives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time, Doc. Yeah... Anyone...  been looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have... But what's the use? (a smile) What'll it be? Altair water... (grandly) Specially carbonated from underground fissures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your usual poison. (confused) To expect one to order poison in a bar is not logical. (he catches himself) Excuse me... I'm on medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. She leaves. McCoy scans the room. He picks out some- one approaching.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: an exotic-looking grubby fellow with a big grin, making his way unmistakably to McCoy's booth. PULL BACK with him as he reaches it, and slides in ebulliently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Welcome to your planet. I think that's my line, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, forgive. I here am new. But you are known, being McCoy from Enterprise. You have me at a disadvantage, sir. You are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I name not important. You seek I. Message received. Available ship stands by. Good. How soon and how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon is now. How much is where? Where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is yes. Where? ... Somewhere in the Mutara Sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Mutara restricted. Take permits many. Money, more. There aren't going to be any damn permits! (checking room) How can you get a permit to do a damn illegal thing?! (then) Look, price you name, money I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You name place, I name money. Otherwise, bargain, no. (getting louder) Alright, dammit. It's Genesis. The name of the place we're going is Genesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely shocked) Genesis! Genesis, yes. How can you be deaf with ears like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genesis allowed is not... Is planet forbidden. Now listen to me, my backwards friend! (grabs the Alien by the collar) Genesis may be "planet forbidden," but I'm damn well -- McCoy is interrupted by a hand on his arm. He looks up to see a nondescript-looking CIVILIAN, with a gentle, ingratiating manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... I'm sorry, but your voice is carrying. I don't think you want to be discussing this subject in public. I'll discuss what I like, and who the hell are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I offer you a ride home, Dr. McCoy? Where's the logic in offering me a ride home, you idiot! If I wanted a ride home, would I be trying to charter a space flight?! (then) How the hell do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federation Security, sir. It's a bad moment for the agent to have announced him- self. A desperate Bones releases the Alien and rises to his feet just as the Waitress arrives with his Alt- air water on a tray. The Altair water spills on the Alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien, hit by the water, leaps to his feet in rage. The Waitress is knocked into a group of people. More spilling of drinks. A bystander, thinking the Alien hit the Waitress, hits him. A general scuffle begins. Meanwhile, McCoy tries to race around the "Civilian's" end of the confusion, but the agent (very big), grabs him. Bones, in confusion and panic, suddenly turns, wild-eyed, and attempts a Vulcan nerve pinch on his tormentor. The nerve pinch has absolutely no effect, and the agent stares at Bones for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get a nice, long rest, Doctor. He ushers Bones out as the brouhaha continues in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GENESIS PLANET
dialogues.text: It is snowing now, and the WIND WAILS as Saavik and David appear and come forward into a CLOSE SHOT. The life sign sound of their TRICORDER is BEEPING faster now as they peer ahead into the snow. Then Saavik suddenly points:

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE SNOWFALL
dialogues.text: Something alive moves across the front, obscured by snow and terrain.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THEM
dialogues.text: As they start forward into the snow, Saavik drawing her phaser. They peer ahead, seeing nothing but the BLEEP of their tricorder which they follow like a beacon. Their POV MOVING through the snow flurry, catches an occasional hint of something ahead which spurs them on. Then, with the TRICORDER BEEP indicating very close proximity, they stop and intuitively Saavik indicates to David to turn the tricorder off. As the beep stops, they listen and hear the tiniest of WHIMPERS amid the WIND. They start out excitedly...

dialogues.speaker: THE CREVICE, (AND INTERCUT POV'S)
dialogues.text: as Saavik and David approach. Stop. TRICORDER back on. Big reading. They step forward through the snow flurry to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wild thing with scraggly hair, perhaps nine or ten years old. He covers his nakedness as he shivers in the cold clutching an injured leg; he watches the strangers, and their BEEPING machine in hypnotic fear.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCENE
dialogues.text: At Saavik's gesture, David turns off his tricorder. Saavik moves close. As she touches the Boy's leg, he pulls back and she reaches out to his face, and touches his cheek softly. he accepts watchfully. Then Saavik slides her hand slowly and parts the scraggly hair. The Boy is a Vulcan. Saavik and David exchange and astonished look. Then she covers the boy with Spock's robe, and in Vulcan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (I am Saavik... Can you speak?) The Boy does not respond. Saavik looks to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in awe) The Genesis Wave... His cells could have been regenerated... Reformed -- Quietly, so as not to alarm the Boy, Saavik opens her communicator and reports softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, this is Saavik. Come in, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Saavik, go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have found the life sign. It is a Vulcan child, perhaps eight to ten years of age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child! That's extraodinary. How did he get there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Dr. Marcus' opinion that this is -- that the Genesis effect has in some way regenerated -- Captain Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH PLANET) There is a moment of uncertainty between Esteban and his science officers that should be one of the grand laughs of this film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly and carefully) Ah, Saavik, that's, ah, extroadinary. What would you, ah, like to do next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request permission to beam aboard immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik... Does Dr. Marcus think there could be -- any chance of -- ah -- radioactive contamination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None that I can detect, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all the same, I'm going to advise Starfleet and get instructions. On the planet, Saavik and David exchange a frustrated look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Starfleet would approve, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but -- let's do it by the book. Stand by on this channel. (to Comm Officer) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet Command, this is the USS Grissom on sub-space coded channel ninety eight point eight. Come in, please... There is an odd SOUND on the speakers. Below, David and Saavik wait impatiently. Then, on the bridge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sir... Something's jamming our transmission. An energy surge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surge from astern, sir. Aft quarter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. On MONITOR, a starfield aappears, with some kind of energy interference. A heat-like distortion of one area of the picture is evident. Then, suddenly, by means of the de-cloaking effect, the Bird of Prey is dead on a at close range in attack configuration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tube one, target, engine section  only!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ready!)

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BRIDGE
dialogues.text: OF PREY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red alert! Raise shields!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, what's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are under attack! Stand by for evasive -- stand by for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fire!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ILM) The BIRD FIRES A Klingon PHOTON TORPEDO which WHOOSHES the relatively short distance to the peaceful Grissom and, shockingly -- blows her to bits with one shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain!... Come in, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruge turns to his gunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (I told you, engine station only!!) Kruge's BEAST GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A fortunate mistake, sir...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (I wanted prisoners!) The BEAST GROWLS again as Kruge, in a rage, pulls out his phaser and FIRES, obliterating the Gunner. No one in the crew seems to take this as unusual behavior. And Kruge adds, for his own justification:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Animal! Kruge's beast adds his contempt to this message. As Kruge stalks from his chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I suggest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling) Say the wrong thing, Torg, and I will kill you too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only meant, my lord, that if it's prisoners you want -- (points to screen) There are life signs on the planet. Perhaps the very scientists you seek. Kruge cocks an eye, examines the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Grissom... This is Saavik on emergency frequency... Come in please...! STATIC is heard on her communicator. She folds it closed in resignation. That unnerves David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik... My god, what happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would seem that Grissom was destroyed by an enemy attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, we're stranded down here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logic indicates that is the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be logical at a time like this?! We have to get thee hell off this planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be difficult...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just call for help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have already made one transmission too many... David looks at her, understanding now, looks away in despair. He covers his face with his hands now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's time for total truth between us. (then) This planet is not what you intended, or hoped for, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically) Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) I used protomatter in the Genesis matrix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protomatter. An unstable substance which every ethical scientist in the galaxy has denounced as dangerously unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) It was the only way to solve certain problems --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your collaborator know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother knew nothing about it. That's why I asked her to leave Genesis in my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, like your father, you changed the rules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hadn't, it might have been years -- or never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how many have paid the price for your impatience? How many have died? How much damage have you done... And what is yet to come? David looks at her, accepting the truth of what she says.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bones McCoy is lying on a cot; we are not yet certain of his mental state, though he looks like a man with a very bad hangover. From O.S.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a visitor, Doc. (then) Make it quick, Admiral. They're moving him to the Federation funny farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and GUARD 1 stand in the doorway which is framed by line of light indicating a force field. Kirk is in civilian clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, poor friend. I hear he's fruity as a nutcake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes. The Guard places an electronic "key" against a plate on the wall. Force light blinks out. As Kirk enters the cell, the Guard reactivates the force field and leaves. Kirk moves quickly to Bones, kneeling beside him. Jim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. How many fingers up? Kirk holds up his hand in the Vulcan salute, fingers splayed. That's not very damn funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches in pocket) Good, your sense of humor's returned. The hell it has. Kirk withdraws syringe. (continuing) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lexorin. Lexorin?! What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're suffering from a Vulcan mind meld, Doctor. ... Spock?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. ... That green blooded son of a bitch!... It's his revenge for all the arguments he lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your arm. This will make you well enough to travel. (re syringe) How do you do this anyway?

dialogues.speaker: ENTRY DOOR
dialogues.text: A SECOND GUARD is on duty with GUARD 1 as the door slides open and Sulu enters with some urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Admiral Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him quickly. Commander, Starfleet wants him right away. Guard 1 fishes for his electronic key and leaves. Guard 2, a big, paunchy man, stretches his girth and yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Keeping you busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get smart, Tiny.

dialogues.speaker: CELL ENTRY AT DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Guard 1 applies his device to the cell electronic plate. Force fields blink out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral... Starfleet is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops him) This man is sick! Look at him! As the Guard moves to Bones, Kirk drops him with a martial chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Can you move? Yah -- that's great stuff. And they start out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON OFFICE
dialogues.text: A BUZZING is heard from the Guard's console. Guard 2 picks up an earpiece (like Uhura's), holds it to ear and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixth Floor Holding... Yah, come up and get him, his visitor's just leaving.              (a beat) What? Well, some Admiral name of -- Kirk. (much squawk in ear) Well how am I supposed to know -- ? He's a damn Admiral! He unplugs furiously, rises determinedly, and starts for the door which, just before he reaches it, slides open, revealing Kirk and Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the hell's going -- He is cut short by a savage martial chop delivered by Sulu from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side elevator. Agents on their way up. Kirk nods and, followed by Bones, moves to the outer door, opens it, and they hurry out. Meanwhile, Sulu has stepped to the master console, a bank of flashing lights and comm equipment. He reaches underneath with an electronic device, then steps back as the entire console shorts itself to oblivion in a shower of sparks and electronic pain. Sulu starts out of the room, but cannot resist stopping for a split second over the fallen body of Guard 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't call me Tiny. As Sulu hurries after the others, we PUSH gently to the fallen giant, sleeping peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk whips out his communicator as they descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unit two, this is One. The Kobayashi Maru has set sail for the promised land. Acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message acknowledged. All units will be informed. Kirk flips his communicator closed. McCoy raises an eyebrow. You're taking me to the promised land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What are friends for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Queen of Space is quietly docked, floodlit like a great monument, but essentially in bed for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, looking cautiously around, stands by the elevator door in the empty corridor. The elevator door opens, and as Scott is preparing to step in, CAPTAIN STYLES steps out. Styles is an officer about Kirk's age. If he's a little stuffy, it's pardonable; he does, after all, have the plum assignment in all of Starfleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mr. Scott. Calling it a night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning in myself. Looking forward to breaking some of Enterprise's speed records tommorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Good night. The doors of the elevators close, leaving Scotty alone inside. A slightly condescending MALE VOICE says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up your shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrast to Excelsior, she seems a ghost ship, unlit and without signs of activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie. Dark. A mysterious hand throws a switch at the transporter panel, and the resulting glow reveals Chekov. A BEAMING SOUND is heard and: Mr. Scott materializes on a pod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Chekov... Let's get some life in the old girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into comm) Roger. Old City Station at 2200 hours. All is well. She releases comm and methodically begins adjusting controls on her console as CAMERA WIDENS to reveal a lanky, cynical Starfleet LIEUTENANT in his early twen- ties; he leans back in his chair, hands clasped behind his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You amaze me, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working) How is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twenty year space veteran, yet you ask for the worst duty station in town. I mean, look at this place: the hind end of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace and quiet appeals to me, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that's okay for someone like you whose career is winding down. But me: I need some challenge in my life. Some adventure... Even just a surprise or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say, Lieutenant. Careful what you wish for: you may get it. The entry door slides open and Kirk, Bones and Sulu hurry in and begin walking without hesitation, toward the pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Gentlemen. Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Commander. Everything ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Admiral. Step into my parlor. The parade of purposeful men passes the befuffled Lieutenant as if he weren't there. He watches as they settle themselves onto the pods, while Uhura busies herself with the setting of controls. He crosses with concern to where she is working so efficiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Commander, these are some of the most famous people in Starfleet! Admiral Kirk, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's damn irregular. No destination orders, no encoded i.d...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- what are we going to do about it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to do nothing about it. You are going to sit in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet?! Have you lost all sense of reality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't reality. This is fantasy. With that Uhura turns, a phaser leveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You wanted adventure? How's this? The old adrenalin going? (he nods) Good boy. Now get in the closet. He backs into it, disappears inside, and she closes the door from her panel. I'm glad you're on our side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re -- the closet) Will you be able to handle that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll have "Mr. Adventure" eating out of my hand. And I'll see you at the rendezvous. (then) All my hopes. She smiles and activates THE BEAM. They wave back to her until they are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES TOWARD the darkened bridge section as energizer and ELECTRONIC SOUNDS are heard, and suddenly from within, the lights begin to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open and Kirk, Bones and Sulu appear on the bridge where activity is now  bustling thanks to Scotty and Chekov. Scotty turns in informal salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As promised, she's all yours, sir. All systems automated and ready. A chimpanzee and two trainees could run her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Scott. I'll try not to take that personally. (to all) My friends... I can't ask you to go any further. Dr. McCoy and I have to do this. The rest of you do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, we're losing precious time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What course please, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be grateful, Admiral, if you'd give the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moment) Gentlemen... may the wind be at our backs. Stations please! As they reach stations, we are on Kirk as a series of orders and responses are given...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Clear all moorings... engage auto systems... one-quarter impulse power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scarred, noble vessel begins to move slowly, im- pulse, rockets WHOOSHING intermittently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEMENTS) It's darkened now, and empty. A lone cleaning man works among the stacked tables as behind him, in the great window, Enterprise begins backing away from Excelsior like a mouse tip-toeing away from a sleeping cat.
