The cleaning man looks up in surprise. What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backing slowly into the last third of the great dock -- and the great closed doors through which she must pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute to space doors. (edgy) You just gonna -- walk through them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm yourself, Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Commander, Starfleet on emergency channel. He orders you to surrender this vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a breath) No reply, Chekov... Continue on course...

dialogues.speaker: STYLE
dialogues.text: Sleeping, he is jarred awake by an alarm KLAXON. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow alert! Captain to the bridge. Yellow alert -- ! Styles fumbles to consciousness, not pleased to be awakened. He gropes for a comm button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge, this is the Captain. How can you have a Yellow Alert in Spacedock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... Someone is stealing the Enterprise! Styless' mouth drops open. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds to spacedoors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir: Excelsior is powering up with orders to pursue. (looks to O.S. screen) My God, she's gaining on us just sitting there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors open, Styles strides in, buttoning tunic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Status!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All automates ready and functioning. Automatic moorings retracted. All speeds available through transwarp drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible machine. Helmsman, one-quarter impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she moves away, heading forward, looking faster than Enterprise even in low speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ILM) They are closed -- and approaching!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... Steady... All right, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an edge) The doors, Mr. Scott! This is not lost on Bines -- But Scotty is too busy to panic, rolling in numbers on his console coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, workin' on it... He presses a final button, looks up at the screen as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slide slowly open just in time to allow Enterprise a narrow passage out into space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweat in his voice) ... We have cleared Spacedoors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picks up speed and EXITS the SHOT... But Excelsior is seen now exiting the Spacedoors and coming on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise maintaining full impulse power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we are gaining... Stand by, tractor beam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tractor beam, aye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he tries to get away with Warp Drive, he's really in for a shock...

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Enterprise first... Excelsior clearly closing the gap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior closing to 4,000 meters, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, we need everything you've got now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir... Warp Drive is standing  by...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk! You do this, you'll never sit in the Captain's chair again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp Speed, Mr. Sulu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir, Warp Speed... He moves his control, SOUND builds, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warp Drive explodes her forward and OUT OF VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, Kirk. (crisply) Prepare for Warp Speed! Standby Transwarp Drive! Appropriate KLAXONS and SOUNDS prepare the ship, the helmsman completes his pre-sets and nods to the first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transwarp at your command, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Execute! There is a massive buildup of SOUNDS, and then -- a sudden series of BANGS, SHAKES, COUGHS and WHEELS, as if the ship had hit a series of potholes in space.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: She begins to shake and vibrate, shuddering her way through space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, impotent SOUNDS no one of them has heard be- fore, and on Styles' face, absolute bafflement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the puzzled McCoy, there seems to be quiet satisfaction on the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior, the great experiment, is adrift in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott: as good as your word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. The more they over- think the plumin', the easier it is to stop up the drain. (turns to McCoy) Here, Doctor, a souvenir as one surgeon to another. He hands McCoy a tiny microchip (INSERT). McCoy looks up bewildered, still shaky from the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I took it out of her main Transwarp computer drive. Nice of you to tell me in  advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) That's what you get for missing staff meetings, Doctor. Gentlemen, your work today was outstanding... I intend to recommend you all for promotion... in whatever fleet we end up serving. There are smiles, but sober ones. And Kirk puts his hand on Sulu's shoulder as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Best speed to Genesis.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Responding to Sulu's touch, she speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey is orbiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maltz and a half-dozen Klingons are on station under Torg. The young officer leans into a monitor with interest. We see two BLIPS there, one converging on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY We are on a Klingon TRICORDER which is BEEPING excitedly. WIDEN to see that it is in Kruge's hand as he advances rapidly, through the oddly changed glade.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S GLADE
dialogues.text: A SERGEANT and one CREWMAN are with Kruge on the planet, always a half step behind his brisk pace. The TRICORDER'S BEEPING INCREASES with each step. Then, abruptly, the PLANETARY RUMBLE is heard -- and the Klingons -- and CAMERA -- STOP, listening to the rumble. The earth shakes. As it does, a hideous, high-pitched SQUEAL is heard, nearby O.S. (This is different than the cry we have heard on the planet.) As the surface stops shaking, the SQUEAL TAPERS OFF -- but the TRI- CORDER BEEPS remain very active. Kruge, his curiosity inflamed, starts forward OUT OF SHOT, the others fol- lowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spock casket is in the f.g. CAMERA RISES now as the Klingons approach the casket, stop short in sur- prise as they see:

dialogues.speaker: SHOCK CUT
dialogues.text: Where the "squiggly forms" once were, now horrible 4- foot-long SERPENTINE THINGS rise, Cobra-like, HISSING and SQUEALING.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kruge is impassive, the others a little shocked. The Sergeant pulls his phaser -- but Kruge stops him with a hand. Now Kruge regards the serpents... then steps forward to them. He does this with total arrogance to reassert his bravery to the crew. CAMERA PULLS with Kruge. He smiles as he reaches the casket. Then he reaches into the group of serpents.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: SHOTS) Kruge grasps one of the elusive Things, brings it close for study. This has the macho quality of a bullfighter getting within an inch of the bull. The crew watches breathlessly. Then, suddenly -- The Thing makes a squidlike coiling motion and wraps itself around Kruge's neck and right arm. It's squeez- ing hard. The crew reacts, but are wisely stayed by the Sergeant. This is the boss's show. Kruge responds in a worthy manner. Even though the  Thing is coiling tightly, Kruge exerts all the strength he has in what he correctly guesses to be the crea- ture's jugular. The creature POPS -- its strength collapses -- and it slithers down and falls away from its conqueror. He takes a moment to enjoy the crew's reaction... then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his communicator) Bridge -- Nothing of consequence here. Am resuming search. The light around him begins to change dramatically. He looks up, and reacts to:

dialogues.speaker: HIGH
dialogues.text: The highest promontory on the small planet gives us a view of the sunlight TERMINATOR LINE (the line between day and night, as on the moon) rolling forward on the terrain below, where we now know the Klingons are. Sunlight is being replaced by night with the rolling motion.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The POV has been his. He watches in wonder as the day- night line crosses him, in a light change. He stands, turns, and looks behind him to see:

dialogues.speaker: GENESIS PEAK
dialogues.text: The highest plateau is turned into night to complete the cycle. We now see this area for the first time as the starlight begins to fill it. A rocky, craggy place with giant tree roots and gnarled shapes everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO DAVID
dialogues.text: He reacts in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: Saavik is ministering to the O.S. boy. We do not yet see his face. We hear his SOFT SOUNDS, the aftermath of cries which we heard earlier. CAMERA CONTINUES MOVING as Saavik takes off her tunic and throws it as an added cover on the O.S. figure. Then she stops, looks at the boy in wonder, as CAMERA completes its arc to reveal the BOY. We are shocked to see the Boy has changed. He is now unquestionably older, perhaps 13 or 14. He is breath- ing heavily as the pain recedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (... Sleep) She rises, and slowly steals out. HOLD on the Boy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Looking out over the darkened planet, lost in thought. WIDEN to admit Saavik. She too looks outward. A dis- tant, FAINT RUMBLE. No tremor felt. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking tricorder  readings) This planet is aging in surges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; then) And Spock with it. They are joined together. Saavik steps forward seeking eye contact and an explan- ation. David looks at her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Genesis wave started a life clock ticking for him and the planet. But at the rate things are going now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days... Maybe hours... Protomatter has made the situation unpredictable. (softly) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accepts; then) It will be hardest on Spock. Soon he will feel the burning of his Vulcan blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pon Farr. Vulcan males must endure it every seventh year of their adult life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't... But his TRICORDER is BEEPING FAINTLY. He checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Whoever they are, they're getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!... I'll do it. (then) Give me your phaser. Their eyes meet. She gives him the phaser. Then he hurries out. HOLD on Saavik. Slightest RUMBLE of the planet. Concern. Is another surge coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes us at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around Kirk is his new "formation"; Chekov is at the Comm station, Sulu at the helm, next to him Scott on weapons/engineering; and at the Spock science post -- well, we haven't seen yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating Genesis 2.9 hours, present speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we hold speed, Mr. Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir, she's got her second wind now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scan for vessels in pursuit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning... Indications negative at this time... You could drop a pin. Everyone turns to Spock's station...

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING BONES
dialogues.text: Did I get it right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did great, Bones... Just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Starfleet calling Grissom again. A warning about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Response?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Nothing. As before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Grissom up to?... Will they join us, or fire on us...? (thinks) Chekov, break radio  silence. Send my compliments to Captain Esteban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Chekov begins calling, as Kirk crosses easily to McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing? (thoughtfully) How are we doing... Funny you should put it quite that way, Jim. (beat) We are doing fine. But I'd feel safer giving him one of my kidneys than what's scrambled in my brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, there is no response from the Grissom on any channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying, Chekov. At regular intervals.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK
dialogues.text: She has fallen asleep in her exhaustion. There is a faint SOUND OF TRICORDER LIFE SIGNS BEEPING. She slum- bers through this. Then, the planet begins to tremble. A RUMBLE. An O.S. CRY, which by now we know is from the young Spock. Saavvik shakes herself, wakes up not knowing what has just happened. The first thing she is aware of is the BEEPING TRICORDER. She checks it, uncertain. Then pulls her communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David... This is Saavik... Come in. There is STATIC, and no response. Then the planet trembles again, and there is a definite O.S. CRY. Saavik reacts in alarm, hurries OUT OF SCENE as the RUMBLING and the CRIES CONTINUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Saavik appears in the opening. We hear the O.S. CRIES OF PAIN from the boy as Saavik watches, sympathetic but helpless. As the CRIES SUBSIDE, and there are no more rumblings, Saavik takes a few steps inside. She sees:

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Hunched down in a corner, his face turned AWAY FROM USS, is Spock. He is now in some kind of awful spasm.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SAAVIK
dialogues.text: She studies what she sees. She understands. His CRY OF RAGE now splits the air and:

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG SPOCK
dialogues.text: He turns TO CAMERA suddenly, a YOUNG MAN in his late teens, lean of face, high of cheekbone. The look on this tortured face and his body language tell us he is fighting for control of body and his world. He is fevered and shuddering. He looks at Saavik with wild eyes which are both frightened -- and frightening.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK
dialogues.text: She approaches him cautiously, but with absolute under- standing. She stops a step away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it has come. Spock hears, but does not understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It is called Pon Farr. He stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Pon Farr.  Her voice has calmed him some. She takes the last step and is now close to him. Calmly and in Vulcan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) (... Will you trust me...?) Spock does not respond; he is in quiet agony. She kneels beside him. His breathing is labored... Saavik offers her hand in Pon Farr configuration -- like a two-finger Boy Scout salute. Spock studies it, then she brings up his right hand in the same configuration. With her two extended fingers she touches his and then slowly begins to stroke his entire hand in gentle fore- play. His breathing eases now, his body begins to relax. Uncertainly, he begins to return the finger- play, first on Saavik's hand and then on her temples. He is more in control now... intense. His eyes turn and lock on hers. Hands touching, they move together until their faces are brushing... and their fingers embrace.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: A moment of soft SPACE AMBIENCE. Then Enterprise glides silently INTO SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are secured from Warp Speed... Now entering Genesis Sector of Mutara Quadrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Grissom, Mr. Chekov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones... Can you give me a quadrant bi-scan? McCoy hunches forward at the science station, but his lack of understanding is clear. I think you just exceeded my capability...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look) Mr. Chekov... With an understanding nod, Chekov crosses toward the science station to take over. (to Kirk) Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your time is coming, Doctor... Mr. Sulu, proceed at impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR SCREEN
dialogues.text: An object appears, accompanied by a SOFT ALARM. PULL BACK. The screen is being watched by Maltz, who reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vessel entering sector. Torg has come up, bends over screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Federation Battle Cruiser. (then) Have they scanned us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage cloaking device. The SOUNDS and lights of cloaking begin...

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG SPOCK, (17)
dialogues.text: Morning light is streaming in. His eyes are closed, he breathes calmly. A hand, Saavik's, ENTERS SHOT, to sooth his brow and smooth his matted hair.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK
dialogues.text: A softer look than we have seen before. But a look of concern and apprehension. She sighs, then picks up communicator. She is about to transmit a message when an instinct makes her put it down, turn to the cave entrance. We PAN with her look to cave entry, low. There, a pair of Klingon boots stand.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SAAVIK
dialogues.text: She reacts, starts to rise, when Klingon hands grab her, pull her to her feet. CAMERA WHIP PANS to young Spock who opens his eyes with a start, stares in con- fusion -- then hands grab him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the cave the Klingon landing party waits. Here, amid gnarled and stoned formations, Saavik and the young Spock are forcibly pulled from the cave and hurled at the feet of:

dialogues.speaker: KRUGE
dialogues.text: A slow PAN UP reveals the Klingon, his patience strained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So! I have come a long way for the power of Genesis. And what do I find? At his gesture, David is thrust forward and thrown among the other two. David shows signs of having been roughed up by the Klingons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) A weakling human... a Vulcan boy ... and a woman! Saavik, assessing the desperate situation, takes her best shot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord... We are survivors of a doomed expedition... This planet will destroy itself in hours. The Genesis experiment is a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A failure! The most powerful destructive force ever created -- ! (then) You will tell me the secret of the Genesis torpedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I hope pain is something you enjoy. The Sergeant steps forward, communicator in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (My Lord...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruge snatches the communicator, barks into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ordered no interruptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir! Federation Starship approaching. For Saavik and David, a moment of hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me up! We're on Saavik and David and the uncomprehending Vulcan as the sound and reflected light of a BEAM-UP take place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the science station, the blue light of the scanner flickering on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd swear something was there sir, but I might have imagined it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see, Chekov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant... A scout class vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Could be Grissom. (then) Patch in the hailing frequency. (at Chekov's nod) U.S.S. Grissom, this is Enterprise calling. Come in, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Favoring David, Saavik and the Vulcan. They hear the voice over the Sergeant's communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grissom, this is Enterprise calling. Do you read? For David, it is the voice of his father and rescue. For Saavik, it is a possibility, just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors slam open as Kruge hurries INTO SCENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle alert. The KLAXON sound... in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say again: Grissom, this is Enterprise. Admiral Kirk calling Captain Esteban or Lieutenant Saavik. Come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report status!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are cloaked. Enemy closing on impulse power. Range, 5,000 Kellicams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (beat) This is the turn of luck I have been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming toward us. Apparently a sitting duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing on my scanner, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short range scan, Mr. Chekov... On screen, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the approaching Genesis planet appears, the planet off to the side. The other two-thirds of the screen appear to be normal star field/space. That is, except for one odd area, slightly diffused, which only the sharp-eyed might notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range: 3000 Kellicams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady. Continue on impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range, 2000 Kellicams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standby to transfer energy to weapons... at my command!

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: (ILM) Smoothly, we are stalking the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ILM ELEMENT) Kirk is studying the projected image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That distortion. We see on the screen a kind of heat wave effect we saw once before when Grissom "bought it." But Grissom did not have Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) See! That shimmering area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. It's getting larger as we close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firing range, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gunner: sight target. Disabling only -- understood?!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Understood clearly, sir.) The beats GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That distortion is closing rapidly... Opinion, Sulu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's an energy form, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Enough energy to hide a ship, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A cloaking device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red alert, Mr. Scott. The KLAXONS BEGIN, the lights dim to red --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1,000 Kellicams, closing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!... Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bathed in combat red light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, all power to the weapons systems --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir! No shields?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my guess is right, they'll have to de-cloak before they can fire. May all your guesses be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott: two photon torpedoes at the ready. Sight on the center of the mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 500 Kellicams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stand by torpedoes -- de-cloak!) The SOUNDS and lights which accompany this, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship begins to de-cloak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEMENTS) where the Bird appears exactly in the spot anticipated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon Bird of Prey, sir! She's arming torpedoes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire, Mr. Scott!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise fires two torpedoes... They impact on the Bird of Prey in separate explosions -- The displacement of the explosions cause the Klingon ship to turn and be pushed back, as if by thrusters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As explosions shake the bridge, filling it with smoke and debris and cries of the injured. And suddenly, CLOSE, Kruge's outraged face appears, smudged by an explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lean forward toward the O.S. viewscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good shooting, Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, those two hits should stop a horse, let alone a bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precautionary, Mr. Chekov. Shields up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the shouts and the orders in Klingon, a dis- orientated Kruge wanders for just a moment until he al- most stumbles across something. It is a body. He looks to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His beast. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A passion of rage. He is back to his instincts now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the cloaking device is destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind! Emergency power to the thrusters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows growing concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the shields... Non- responsive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The automation system's overloaded. I didn't expect to take us into combat, ya know...! He begins hitting buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lateral thrust!... Standby weapons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thrusters stabilize her turning and backward movement. She is now lined up with a splendid angle on Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fire!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torpedoes coming in -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she shudders and tilts with the hits, and the flashes of flame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast hits. Scotty's panel sizzles... LIGHT OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency power! The light return, EMERGENCY MODE. The ship rights itself. Kirk has been knocked down. Bones to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right -- stand by to return fire! Mr. Scott, transfer power to the phaser banks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, sir, I dinna think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've knocked out the damn automation center. (pounds his panel in rage) I've got no control over anything! Kirk pales, looks quickly to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu...?! But Sulu's gesture says he has no control of helm, and Chekov also shakes his head in helplessness. Kirk digests this. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So... We're a sitting duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOULDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency power re-charge is 40 percent... 50 percent... (he turns now) Ready for fire emergency tube...! ANGLE WIDENS to include Kruge, who raises his hand for pause, and thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't they finished us?... They outgun me ten to one; they have four hundred in crew to my handful, yet they sit there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps they wish to take you prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know we would die first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord, enemy commander wishes a truce to confer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him on screen! (to Torg) Study him well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is a different configuration than we are used to; Kirk's image appears. (We will INTERCUT the Planet and Enterprise as needed during following sequence.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Admiral James T. Kirk of the Federation Starship Enterprise. On the Bird of Prey: Kruge's reaction to Kirk's face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So! The Genesis Commander himself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... By violation of treaty between the Federation and Klingon Empire, your presence here is an act of  war. You have two minutes to surrender your crew and your vessel, or we will destroy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Torg) He's hiding something. We may have dealt him a more serious blow than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust my instincts. (leans to comm button) Admiral Kirk. This is your opponent speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Kruge's voice is heard here, and on the planet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not lecture me about treaty violations. The Federation, in creating an ultimate weapon, has become a gang of Intergalactic criminals. It is not I who will surrender, it is you. (a pause) On the planet below, I have three prisoners from the team who developed your doomsday weapon. If you do not surrender immediately, I will execute them, one at a time, as enemies of galactic peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?! How dare you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who I am is not important. That I have them is. (beat) I will let you speak to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kruge's VOICE barks a Klingon order over the commun- icator, Saavik, David and the Vulcan are rousted to their feet by the Klingons, and assembled in a line. The Sergeant thrusts the communicator in front of Saavik, pokes her to make his command clear. She leans into the communicator, controlling carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, this is Lieutenant Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Saavik... Is... David with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is. And someone else. Vulcan scientist of your acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Vulcan -- is he alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not himself -- but he lives. He is subject to rapid aging -- like this unstable planet. The Sergeant has had enough with her long windedness, pulls the communicator and thrusts it in front of David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sir. It's David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) David... Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay -- I should have known you'd come... Saavik's right: this planet is unstable. It's going to destroy itself in a matter of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David!... What went wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went wrong. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. Just don't surrender. Genesis doesn't work! I can't believe they'll kill us for it -- But a Klingon crew member has cut David off the air --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and STATIC FILLS THE SPEAKERS on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David?... David!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, your young friend is mistaken. I meant what I said. And now, to show my intentions are sincere... I am going to kill one of the prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Give me a chance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to communicator) (Kill one of them. I don't care which.)

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET
dialogues.text: The Sergeant has received the order. He draws a dis- tinctive Klingon dagger, frightening to behold. As KIRK'S VOICE is heard, INDISTINCTLY PROTESTING over the communicator, the Sergeant walks behind the assembled line of the three prisoners: the Vulcan youth, Saavik, and David. It is like a game of Russian Roulette. We do not know where the blow will fall. Then, the Sergeant has picked his victim, and raises his dagger back to strike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Saavik he intends to kill. David, his face curled in rage, leaps forward. grabs the man's arm. The struggle is short. David takes a knife in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRY OF PAIN is heard on the speakers. There is a horrible silence that follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik?!... David...!? At last we hear the shaken voice of Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral. David is dead. There is none of these three Kirk would have parted with. But David... He fights back the horror as Bones steps to his side -- but finally he must let it go:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Klingon bastard! You've killed my son...! Kruge takes this news with a blink of triumph. Calmly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two more prisoners, Admiral. Do you want them killed too? (a beat) Surrender your vessel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a scream) All right, damn you! All right! (a trembling mo- ment, then) Give me a minute to inform my  crew.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: Kruge, pleased his gambit has worked, is magnanimous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give two minutes. For you, and your gallant crew. (clicks off; to Torg) Take every last man: form a boarding party, armed heavily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They outnumber us, my Lord --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are Klingons! Once you control the ship, I will transfer my flag there. And we will take Genesis from their own memory banks!

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The crew has come forward to stand behind Kirk's com- mand chair. Kirk is staring ahead, his eyes glazed. Jim. You okay? Kirk turns to face McCoy. His face is hollow, his eyes staring. Then, in a voice strained with grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, what is the crew complement of a Bird of Prey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a dozen officers and men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) With some on the planet... He turns to them, his voice hoarse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I swear to you, we're not finished yet. We never have been, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Bones, you and Sulu to the transporter room. The rest with me. We have a job to do. As the individuals respond to orders, PUSH TO Kirk as he presses his COMM button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Commander, Klingon vessel. Stand by to board this ship on my next signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tricks, Kirk. You have one  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tricks. I'm looking forward to meeting you. Kirk out. He steps to the science station as Chekov and Scotty gather round. He leans in, presses a COMM button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Computer, destruct Sequence One, code one, one-A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruge is inspecting the six man landing party as- sembled by Torg. They are loaded down with weapons. Kruge raises his arm and points:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the transporter room. Success!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Success!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, this is Commander Chekov, acting Science Officer. Destruct sequence two, code one, one-A, two-B. Scotty steps in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, this is Commander Scott, Chief Engineering Officer. Destruct sequence three, code one- B, two-B, three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruct sequence completed and engaged. Awaiting final code for one-minute countdown. A moment among them. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code zero, zero, zero destruct zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute... fifty-nine seconds ... fifty-eight... fifty-seven... And they hurry out. CAMERA MOVES to a visual display which is counting in sync with the COMPUTER VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Kruge, alone with Maltz, checks time impatiently, hits a talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, your time runs out. Report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUNNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk, Scotty and Chekov hurry in. Kirk stops as the others move O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips communicator) Commander, Klingon vessel. We are energizing transporter beam... Now. As the ELECTRONIC WIND UP begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter stand by!

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE TRANSPORTER ROOM, (ILM ELEMENT)
dialogues.text: As the POWER WHINE INCREASES, Kirk steps on one of the transporter pods, joining Scotty, McCoy, Sulu and Chekov. After a few endless seconds, they begin to DE-MATERIALIZE AND VANISH. There is a FLICKER, a pause. Are they returning? Have they been blocked? No. The second BEAM EFFECT materializes the Klingon landing party. They pause guardedly, phasers drawn. Then, led by Torg, they start out. We are faintly aware of a soft COMPUTER VOICE counting off seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Kruge waits, patiently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingon landing party enters, proceeds cautiously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deserted except for the soft COMPUTER VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two... twenty-one... twenty... The sliding door opens and Torg leads the Klingons in, weapons drawn. They check out the bridge as the VOICE CONTINUES FAINTLY, unobserved by the Klingons. Then Torg pulls out his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord. The ship appears to be deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can this be? They are hiding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. But the bridge appears to be run by computer. It is the only thing speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking? Let me hear... Torg, puts his communicator close to the computer's panel speaker and the voice is quite loud now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six... five... four... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Get out of there! Get out! Torg and his men are baffled by Kruge's distress when a sudden SERIES OF EXPLOSIONS engulf the bridge, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a fireball streaks through the empty companionway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF SHOTS  (INTERCUT)     The great ship is wrecked by an EXPLOSION, then AN- OTHER, and ANOTHER in a chain of designed destruction. (ILM) The skin of the circular section ruptures, cracks open like an arid desert; the star drive section bursts and trembles... (ILM) Kruge watching in frustrated rage... Like a fiery comet, Enterprise falls gracefully out of orbit, burning up as she plunges, toward her death. (ILM) Saavik; the young Vulcan, watching. She, uncertain. He, staring blankly... We see Enterprise in the distance, a small fireball in the outer edge of the Genesis atmosphere. (ILM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comet-like death of Enterprise in the distance is being watched by a silhouetted group as the sun sets.

dialogues.speaker: TWILIGHT
dialogues.text: The five survivors of Enterprise, temporarily safe, watch in awe and grief as their home of twenty years dies in the ominous sky beyond. On each face, the light left by Enterprise flickers, then at last, is gone. Kirk watches with hollowed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, Bones. What have I done? What you had to do. What you always do. Turned death into a fighting chance to live. (concerned) You hear me, Jim? Kirk takes a deep breath, nods his understanding to McCoy. Even as the earth trembles, and Sulu's tri- corder begins to go a little wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, planet core readings unstable... Changing rapidly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about surface life signs...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close... There --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draws phaser) Come on! They hurry off in the direction Sulu has pointed, as the GROWLS AND RUMBLES of the planet begin to accelerate. Night is falling.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY BRIDGE
dialogues.text: He is watching something O.S. with apprehension. WIDEN to reveal Kruge in f.g. going through his own crisis, an agony of self-loathing. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord... what are your orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mainly to himself) I underestimated him... He did the one thing I didn't anticipate ... He destroyed himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing his son was stupid! It made Kirk willing to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have the prisoners, sir. Perhaps their information --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are useless! It was Kirk I needed. And I let him slip away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely, our mission has not failed -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our mission is over. I have failed... A human has been bolder and more ruthless than I... (a beat) That -- is the real dishonor. As Maltz watches him uncertainly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Klingons guard the seated Saavik. Spock is isolated, some distance away. The death RUMBLINGS of the planet begin to INCREASE with each moment. The sky beyond occasionally lights with awesome flashes of electrical energy; the ground shakes in unpredictable spurts. Suddenly, a tree vaults upward, as if pushed from its place by a force below. The TREE GROANS AN CRASHES toward the ground, the Klingons leaping out of its way.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING SAAVIK
dialogues.text: As the two Klingons are distracted, and the planet's agony continues, Saavik slips away from them toward Spock.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: He is seated, BACK TO US. His aging spasms has begun, and with each earth RUMBLE of the planet, he suffers.

dialogues.speaker: THE KLINGONS
dialogues.text: concerned about their own problems, and the silence from their ship. The Sergeant pulls his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lord Commander... This place is destructing... What are your orders?... STATIC CRACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) (My Lord... Recommend beaming up ourselves and the prisoners...) While he waits for an answer, his eyes catches Saavik's progress toward Spock. He calls this to his subordi- nate's attention with a guttural grunt, and the second Klingon hurries off to correct the situation.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: As she nears the suffering Vulcan, the Klingon reaches her, and with a strong arm, hurls her easily aside. The GROUND RUMBLES again. The Vulcan cries out. THE Klingon, fascinated by the Vulcan's behavior, approaches, then, reaches out toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't touch him! The Klingon ignores. He puts his hand on the Vulcan, and for his trouble, in a blur of action, gets grabbed, whacked, and hurled through the air by a burst of the Vulcan's strength. The Klingon lands at the base of the gnarled tree and lies quite still, his neck broken.

dialogues.speaker: THE KLINGON SERGEANT
dialogues.text: reacts in shock to what has happened, draws his phaser, all business now as he studies:

dialogues.speaker: THE VULCAN
dialogues.text: Hands over his face as he twists in pain. He emits a long, terrible CRY, the cry we've heard, but never seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and the crew are coming to the rescue, running amid the TREMORS and the flashes of light, whipped by wind and flailing trees. As the CRY is heard THROUGH THE WIND, they pull up, listening. The CRY AGAIN, close by. Kirk leads them out on the run.

dialogues.speaker: THE KLINGON CAMP
dialogues.text: Saavik has returned to try to help Spock. She holds him now, as his spasms continue. The Sergeant comes forward, phaser in hand, until he reaches the Vulcan, held by Saavik. The Klingon stops, mesmerized. He stares at:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPOCK
dialogues.text: His features are changing before our eyes, his face distending... Saavik, looking back at the Klingon, clutches the ago- nized Spock to her, trying in some way to protect him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SERGEANT
dialogues.text: He's frightened. He reflexively raises his phaser...

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING'S EDGE
dialogues.text: The flash of lightning illuminates the arrival of Kirk and the crew. Kirk, phaser leveled --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!! The Klingon whirls to face the new threat, whips his phaser toward Kirk -- But Kirk FIRES A STUN BLAST...

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDING THE KLINGON
dialogues.text: The STUN WAVES zip at the Klingon, strike him with spectacular force, cause him to somersault through the air, and then, landing, lie still.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kirk lowers his phaser; he and the others stare at: Saavik, holding the now immobile Spock. The Enterprise family reacts; with Kirk and Bones lead- ing, they rush to Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and the others have pulled up. Spock is now coma- tose, breathing with labored sighs. We cannot see his face, cradled in Saavik's comforting embrace. But Saavik  is looking up at Kirk with dazed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bones... McCoy crosses quickly, takes the Vulcan's form from Saavik as she rises to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Admiral. Even a half-Vulcan has a breaking point. She sags for just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Saavik. It's all right. As he holds Saavik, his eyes flick over her shoulder to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnoticed up to now, half covered by leaves, the body of David, Kirk's fallen son.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He reacts. Then, with a last comforting hug to Saavik, he breaks the embrace, and heads slowly for David's body. She watches him EXIT SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S BODY
dialogues.text: WIDEN to admit Kirk as he enters, kneels. He reaches out, touches hiss son's brow, wipes a leaf away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a intimate whisper) My son... "To thee no star be dark... Both Heaven and Earth... Friend thee forever..." Saavik has come up behind him. She hangs back. Then Kirk rises, aware of her presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What happened...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave his life to save us. That is all I know. ... Jim! Kirk runs, hurries OUT OF SHOT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 233   FAVORING McCOY AND SPOCK With the crew gathered around, McCoy is scanning the Vulcan's body, soothing his fevered brow. We cannot see Spock's face, but Kirk ass he enters and kneels beside McCoy. He reacts, mesmerized by what he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bones...?! ... Rapid aging... all genetic functions highly accelerated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his mind? It's a void. It would seem, Admiral, that I've got all his  marbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything we can do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one thing, Sir... Get him off this planet... His aging is part of what's going on around us... There is a lightning FLASH, and an earth TREMOR -- and a moan from Spock. Kirk responds, rises, and crosses OUT OF SHOT...

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: As he moves, stops, wrestling with the urgency of what must be done. Then, deciding, he whips out his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to communicator) Klingon Commander, this is Admiral James T. Kirk... I am alive and well on the planet's surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this will come as a pleasant surprise for you... But you see our ship was the victim of an unfortunate accident... I'm sorry about your crew, old boy, but -- c'est la vie, as we say on Earth... A lightning flash makes him cover his eyes... Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well? I'm waiting for you!... What is your answer?! (only static; more desperately) I have what you want. I have the secret of Genesis... But you'll have to bring us up there to get it... Do you hear me! More STATIC. Kirk's ploy has apparently failed. He sags a bit, starts back toward the crew, when another series of flashes blind them all as the planet rumbles with sound and fury and Spock moans. Then, Kirk and crew do not see what to do: In the near distance, amid the flashings, a figure is revealed, lost in the confusion. It is Kruge, phaser in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Drop all weapons!

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING KIRK AND CREW, PAST KRUGE
dialogues.text: Kirk and the others look up in shock, then rise slowly hands in the air. Kruge moves closer, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there, All but Kirk. The group moves to a cleared space indicated, leaving Spock's form behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to his comm:) Maltz. Prisoners are at beam coordinates. Standby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easily) You should take the Vulcan, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you wish it. (then, in Klingon) (Maltz! Activate beam!)

dialogues.speaker: FX SHOT
dialogues.text: McCoy, Scotty, Sulu, Chekov and Saavik disappear in the beam effect and are gone.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A flash of lightning! A movement of earth. The sudden HISS of a FISSURE OF STEAM through the surface... And the two men face each other, shouting above the planet noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genesis, I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beam the Vulcan up -- And we talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me what I want -- and I'll consider it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool -- look around you! This planet is destroying itself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Exhilarating, isn't it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't help each other, we'll all die here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! That's the way it shall be!... Give me Genesis! Suddenly, the very ground on which he stands seems to become an elevator. He is carried rapidly upward on a craggy rock formation which bursts upward, out of the ground. Kruge tumbles, and Kirk seizes the opportunity --

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHT
dialogues.text: Kirk leaps upon Kruge and they roll and struggle on the churning, erupting ground. They are evenly matched. Kirk's opening momentum holds until Kruge's great size begins to turn the tide. He takes temporary command with swift vicious kicks and punches. Kirk is down. Kruge now looks around for his phase, starts for it, but Kirk, in a series of ground rolls trips Kruge up with his legs, and comes on. The off-balance Kruge now takes a series of punches from Kirk which make him reel backward near the edge of the promontory. A final blow from Kirk forces Kruge over the edge -- and he: -- tumbles and rolls down the fifteen foot slope. Kirk peers over the edge to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kruge has landed on a level precipice about fifteen feet in diameter. Beyond that is an endless drop into a chasm, the bottom of which has become a glowing red river of LAVA.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PRECIPICE
dialogues.text: As Kruge rises to his feet, Kirk without hesitation soars into the air from above and dives upon Kruge, the momentum of the dive taking both men right to the edge of the final drop. They work their way to their feet and continue the struggle anew, pieces of the rock edge slipping away under their feet as they scuffle. Kirk is winning until: With a burst of energy, Kruge shoves Kirk hard and Kirk slams into a wall of stone, dazed. Kruge has him -- but as he starts to step forward, the edge of the rock he is standing on starts to slip.

dialogues.speaker: FULL
dialogues.text: Kirk on the left against the wall, Kruge on the right, on the edge. Kruge is dropping lower. The rock forma- tion he is on now breaks away, carrying him outward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Jump -- damn you! Kruge does jump forward at the last possible instant as the rock falls away. He leaps to:

dialogues.speaker: THE NEW EDGE OF THE PRECIPICE, (ILM ELEMENTS)
dialogues.text: Where Kruge lands precariously, hanging on almost by his fingernails. He's holding on as best as he can, his legs flailing, unable to gain any purchase to boost him up. Kirk, recovering his own strength, sees Kruge in this helpless situation. He comes forward to the edge, kneels over the Klingon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand and we both live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams a curse in Klingon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool -- give me your hand! Kruge looks down, measuring the terror below as if considering, then with sudden and explosive strength, vaults upward making a desperate grab for Kirk. He has a leg! Suddenly, Kirk is fighting not to be pulled over the edge. He is losing that fight. Till he lashes out with a blow. The Klingon's grip slips, yet he hangs on tenaciously, until -- with a cry of rage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have had... enough... of you!! Kirk turns and kicks Kruge mightily -- and the Klingon begins his fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk in f.g. watches as Kruge tumbles endlessly toward the steaming red hot lava beds below...

dialogues.speaker: ON KIRK
dialogues.text: He turns now to his ultimate problem: the planet is caving in around him. He starts to scramble up the steep slope, back to the promontory where --

dialogues.speaker: THE PROMONTORY
dialogues.text: His inert body lies, surrounded by new bursts of steam from the cracking earth...

dialogues.speaker: KIRK, (ILM ELEMENT)
dialogues.text: Behind him we see the first signs of a fast rising fireball sun. He claws his way back to the top level and races to Spock's fallen form. He kneels and turns the body over to see:

dialogues.speaker: PAST KIRK TO SPOCK
dialogues.text: We see the face at last: it is Spock, at the age he died. But he is also a haggard, ravaged shell of a being, almost again dead from the agonies of change -- and even now, with soft frightening sounds, giving indications of the final changes that lie just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: Amid the death knell of this place, Kirk knows it is now or never. A desperate idea forms. With determination, he picks Spock up and shoulders him. Then drawing his communicator, he flips it open and takes his best shot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in guttural Klingon) (Maltz... Activate beam!...) There is a moment of uncertainty. Kirk is about to try again when the Klingon beam SOUND begins and...

dialogues.speaker: BEAM UP EFFECT
dialogues.text: Amid the groans, flashes, the HISSES OF STEAM and falling debris, Kirk, carrying Spock dematerializes in the KLINGON BEAM, even as the sun appears to be coming closer...

dialogues.speaker: MASTER
dialogues.text: ... and closer still, casting yellow white light over the disintegrating surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors WHOOSH open, and Kirk, carrying the inert Spock, steps out, phaser at the ready!

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Maltz on the Captain's deck, the Enterprise prisoners below. Maltz turns, expecting Kruge, and is clearly astonished; as he raises his hands, Kirk steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just him, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, help Spock! Everyone else, find a station! A flurry of activity as the crew moves into position in the strange -- yet familiar bridge. McCoy takes Spock from Kirk, guides him OUT OF SCENE, and Saavik takes Maltz' phaser and steps back. To Maltz:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You! Help us or die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not deserve to live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll kill you later! Let's get out of here! And so saying, he dashes OUT OF SHOT, followed by Saavik. The Klingon can only stare in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: We are near her now ERUPTING surface; flames shoot out. Beyond, her sun waits, former friend, now ready to accept the planet in death.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Kirk in command, Sulu and Saavik on nearby station. They are confronted by familiar tools, but baffling zymology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone here read Klingon? No one does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, take your best shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty hunched over the console, Chekov hunched over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can bypass into the module -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, but where's the damn anti- matter inducer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.? No, this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This or nothing. Scotty makes several adjustments, presses some buttons, then, with a deep breath, moves a sliding handle for- ward. A HIGH WHINE STARTS, WAVERS, THEN GROWS ROBUST.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Sulu responds to the panel indicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I read this right, sir, we have full power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Sulu! Sulu impels the throttle device -

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Turning gracefully, she gains speed, PASSES CAMERA, and heads for the stars with increasing velocity breaking to Warp Speed as -

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The planet is now heading toward the sun. We watch in wonder as she gains speed and becomes a glazing fireball, plummeting spectacularly to her own destruction.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The mood is subdued, somber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Genesis planet is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Goodbye, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are clear and free to navigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best speed to Vulcan. Mr. Chekov, take the prisoners below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. As he starts to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! You said you would kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied. At Kirk's gesture, Chekov leads Maltz out. Kirk turns back to his panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating Vulcan at point one niner. CAMERA MOVES IN to Kirk and Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik: message to Ambassador Sarek. Tell him we bring McCoy and a living Spock. Ask him to prepare for the Katra ritual. Saavik raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Admiral. But that may not be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) What? What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Katra ritual is meant to deposit Spock's consciousness in the Hall of Ancient Thought - not in his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have Spock alive! That's more than we bargained for!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or less. What you describe is called Fal Tor Pan - the refusion. It is very dangerous. The elders may not choose to attempt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they don't.? What will Happen to Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . He will remain always as he is. As Kirk wrestles with the horror of this we see:

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: He is pale, comatose, fragile looking. WIDEN as Bones passes a scanner over the form; the scanner's sound is feeble. McCoy stops in frustration, checks Spock's eyes; then turns back, wearily. Softly, as CAMERA begins to ARC around them. (wearily) Spock. I've done everything I know (to do). Help me!. You struck me with it, for God's sake, teach me what to do with it! (a pause, then) I never thought I'd say this to you. but it seems I've missed you. And I couldn't bear to lose you again. He lowers his head in helpless grief on the form of the unmoving Spock, and CAMERA'S ARC has revealed Kirk standing, watching. Kirk steps forward now, puts his hand gently on McCoy, then on Spock. Three lives, intertwined for so long.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: HOLD. The ROAR of an unseen spaceship is heard, and, the Bird of Prey ENTERS SHOT, heading toward Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirk enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet Vulcan. In hailing distance, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik. Send to Ambassador Sarek. Tell him we're coming in.

dialogues.speaker: DUS
dialogues.text: (ILM) LOOKING DOWN on the awesome mountainous landscape with a temple complex on a high forbidding peak. SLOW ZOOM IN TO MATCH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zooming at comparable speed, to a CLOSE UP of Spock's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On approach. Permission to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission granted. Tell Kirk we'll be ready. CAMERA PANS now from Sarek to reveal Uhura, in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send the message, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at impulse power, approach speed. Her "wings" config- urate into atmospheric lift generating airfolis; she glides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, you're on manual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while, sir. Here we go... Retrothrusters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship descends slowly and gracefully to a soft landing in the Temple area, retro's kicking dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As energizers wind down, Kirk hits comm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, let's get him off-loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a RAMP section of the plane HISSES and lowers to the ground. Spock is carried down on a litter borne by his friends. As they reach the bottom, Kirk is in f.g., and looks in amazement to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great hill to the Temple is lined with hundreds of Vulcans, many with torches. It is most impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 273   BACK TO KIRK - McCOY - SAAVIK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much is at stake... Then Kirk sees something else, reacts as:

dialogues.speaker: UHURA
dialogues.text: Crosses to the crew -- is hugged by Kirk. Her eyes are moist with emotion as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek is waiting above... Kirk nods, and Uhura falls in place behind him, helping to carry Spock's form with the others. They now carry Spock OUT OF SCENE as we begin to hear RITUAL CHANTS and MUSIC in the distance. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The procession is in progress through a path lined on both sides by simply-robed Vulcans of all ages. Spock's form makes passage to stately MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vulcans responding to Spock's passage. FEATURE: A small girl releases herself from her father's grip and moves alongside the body, makes the Vulcan salute, and whispers with great solemnity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Live long and prosper, Spock... REACTION CUTS from Kirk and the others. And we -- DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS Sarek, some DIGNITARIES, and SIX VULCAN WOMEN, tall and stately, are waiting. MUSICIANS are close by now. As the Enterprise group reaches Sarek, he steps forward to meet them. Now a silence falls. Sarek stands at his son's head and gently places his two hands on Spock's face. When he is done, he looks at Kirk and McCoy. They search his face for some indication of hope, but Sarek is expressionless. He steps back now, gestures. The Vulcan women come forward, and take Spock from his friends. As the transfer is completed, the procession begins again toward the temple entry. Sarek falls in behind the body; Kirk and his group follow him. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hall of Ancient Thought, lined with massive heads of stone. DOLLY with the procession as an amazing thing takes place: As Spock's body moves, now seen -- now blocked by passing forms, we realize the bearers' hands are no longer under the body, but are ON TOP OF IT. The magic of this moment is not lost on Kirk, Bones and the others as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great saucer-shaped platform under the Vulcan sky, with an altar at the far end. The dramatic figure of a VULCAN PRIESTESS stands there. Rising into the air behind her is an elegant version of the Vulcan hand salute shaped in gleaming metal. The bearers continue with Spock toward the altar, but Sarek stops here on the threshold, and stops Kirk and group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you will wait. Sarek turns to face the altar. Spock's body is deposited there to ritual MUSIC. Then, the powerful CHANT of the HIGH PRIESTESS begins. Kirk and McCoy and the others stare in awe at what is happening, as the Priestess' chant flows over them. Then, the CHANT ENDS. Sarek steps forward. A HORN.. ..SOUNDS. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek... Child of Skon... Child of Solkar. The body of your son breathes still. What is your wish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask for Fal-Tor-Pan, the refusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you seek has not been done since ages past -- and then, only in legend. Your request is not logical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, T'Lar. My logic falters where my son is concerned. She looks at him for a long moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the Keeper of the Katra? As Sarek's nod and Kirk's urgent look, Bones replies uncertainly: I am... McCOY... Leonard H. (adding) Son of David...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep, ominous) McCoy... Son of David. Since thou art human, we cannot expect thee to understand fully what Sarek has requested. The circumstances are extraordinary: Spock's body lives... With your approval, we shall use all our powers to return to his body that which you possess: his essence. But McCoy... (a pause) You must now be warned! the danger to thyself is as grave as the danger to Spock. (this impacts on McCoy and Kirk) You must make the choice. (pause, then...) I choose the danger. (then, aside to Kirk) Helluva time to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him forward. As Sarek leads Bones toward the altar, we HOLD on Kirk's new apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: SHOTS Sarek and McCoy reach the altar, and Sarek departs. The Priestess intones another short CHANT, punctuated by GONGS and MUSICAL emphatics. Then chant and music stop and we hear only the gentle SOUND OF THE WIND, and far-off TEMPLE CHIMES. She places a hand on Bones' face, another on Spock's. Then, eerily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that can be done... shall be done... Though it take full turn of the Vulcan sun... SOFT MUSIC now. She begins drifting into a trance like mind meld, chanting softly, almost inaudibly. CLOSE on McCoy... And Spock... Their eyes are closed. A sense of kinetic energy somehow passing between them... The crew of the Enterprise, each and all... Waiting...

dialogues.speaker: FROM ABOVE
dialogues.text: The great altar area, the land and valley beyond. Lightning streaks the sky.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: The lightning flashes are reflected in his face as we MOVE SLOWLY IN on his concerned face... and VERY SLOWLY - LONG DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: (ILM) The early morning sun casts a different, long-shadowed hot look on the altar and threshold.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: From where they had watched from last night, here they ha waited, lain down. They are beginning to stir when the SOUND OF A GONG brings them fully awake. They rise, bleary eyed to see:

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: The High Priestess, exhausted, is being carried out of the altar area on a sedan chair. As she leaves, Sarek, supporting a weary McCoy, heads a procession of hooded robed priests. Among them we now see a HOODED ROBED FIGURE all in WHITE. The procession is passing Kirk's party, while Kirk and the crew can only stare in uncertainty. Then, Sarek signals the others to continue while he, with McCoy, breaks off and comes to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND CREW
dialogues.text: They wait now as Bones, leaning on Sarek, ENTERS SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones...? All right... I'm all right, Jim. Sulu and Scotty reach for him, help support him. He is weakened, but otherwise all right. Kirk gestures toward the white-robed figure walking slowly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not sure. Only time will answer. (then) Kirk. I thank you. What you have  done is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I have done, I had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at what cost? Your ship... Your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hadn't tried, the cost would have been my soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek looks at him with deep admiration, then turns and heads back to the group of priests. The wind blows, and --

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND GROUP
dialogues.text: They are now looking into the low sun, shading their eyes for a last look at the white-robed figure.

dialogues.speaker: SAREK AND GROUP
dialogues.text: They are moving slowly away when, suddenly, the white- robed figure stops, turns toward the Enterprise group.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHITE HOOD
dialogues.text: We cannot see the features beneath, but we know the figure is staring. After a moment, the figure starts back to the Enterprise group. As two priests reach to stop him, they are stayed by Sarek, who now watches with interest.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND GROUP
dialogues.text: watching with held breath as the white-robed figure walks steadily to them, reaches them.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Back lit. The wind whips his garment. Now he lowers his hood. We see Spock: a radiant, gentled Spock. His age is as we have known it; his hair, his face, the same; he would look at peace except for the eyes, which remain hollow, filled with questions and uncertainties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise crew, each of them stares back at Spock as SUBJECTIVE CAMERA PANS PAST them SLOWLY. Each makes hi own effort to be remembered, but -- Spock remains churning, but uncertain. Then he looks hardest at all at: Kirk. The wind whips his hair. Something triggers in Spock. He steps forward, and then in an odd, rusty voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you... Do I not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father says you have been my friend... You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have done the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching) Why would you do this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping to make a connection) Because... the needs of the one outweighed the needs of the many. Spock stares at him. A vague connection has been made -- but not enough. Spock turns away in uncertainty, begins walking back to the group he left. Kirk raises his helpless hand after Spock, wondering what he might have said, should have said -- when suddenly: Spock stops, back to Kirk. He closes his eyes, looks to the sky. And like someone who has found a piece of a puzzle, he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been... and ever shall be... your friend. Kirk steps forward a few steps -- hushed, encouraging --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half turns) The ship... Out of danger...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply) You saved the ship, Spock. You saved us all. Don't you remember?! There is an odd moment after Kirk's impassioned speech: Spock cocks his head as if some vital piece of informa- tion had just clicked into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) ... Jim... Your name is Jim. Kirk's eyes well with tears. He nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes. Their eyes are locked together. Spock gives a little nod of satisfaction, as if knowing he has taken the first of many steps. He turns to share this with McCoy... And then with them all. We have the feeling that Spock has come back to his family... and to us...

dialogues.speaker: ON ENTERPRISE FAMILY
dialogues.text: They have gathered round Kirk now, beaming at Spock through their tears and their joy, knowing they all have a future together. As the CAMERA PULLS UP AND BACK from this, we ROLL END CREDITS and -- FADE OUT.
